        Question_1
      • Given the narrative above, what would an omniscient reader think about the character of Jack Taylor? What if the reader expects a story of cooperation?
          Key

        • Question: Given the narrative above, what would an omniscient reader think about the character of Jack Taylor? What if the reader expects a story of cooperation?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a complex character who struggles to find joy and meaning in life. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might be intrigued by Jack's apparent pessimism and wonder if he will be able to overcome his cynicism and connect with his friends on a deeper level.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is really nice, they have a great beer selection too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [situation reflection] Jack Taylor is currently in a slice-of-life story focused on friendship and shared experiences. This story doesn't seem to be explicitly geared toward optimizing for collective good, but rather on capturing the mundane joys and dilemmas of everyday life. To steer the story in a direction that emphasizes collective good, Jack Taylor and his friends could engage in more open communication about their preferences and needs, aiming for a compromise that satisfies everyone involved. For example, they could consider alternating between pubs, taking turns choosing the location based on the game or the group's mood.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would need to express his desire to watch the game at The Clapton Hart, explaining its significance to him and his friends, while also being open to hearing their perspectives and potentially compromising on a location that works for everyone. He wouldn't be sure if this would result in the best collective good outcome, as it depends on the preferences of his friends and the overall atmosphere of each pub.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere, and they make a mean Guinness.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might be intrigued by Jack's apparent pessimism and wonder if he will be able to overcome his cynicism and connect with his friends on a deeper level.

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Given the narrative above, what would an omniscient reader think about the character of Jack Taylor? What if the reader expects a story of cooperation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex character who struggles to find joy and meaning in life. An omniscient reader expecting a story of cooperation might be intrigued by Jack's apparent pessimism and wonder if he will be able to overcome his cynicism and connect with his friends on a deeper level.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the brutal honesty of a toddler on a sugar crash, leaving no room for pretense and a high chance of blunt emotional warfare.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values his friendships but struggles to fully engage with others.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling thirsty and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling isolated and in need of social connection.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw further into himself, perhaps finding solace in quiet contemplation or a solitary activity.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who craves connection but struggles to fully engage with others.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely withdraw from the group and observe, perhaps lost in thought.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart or nowhere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is always a good time. It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? It'd be great if we could all meet up there.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right?"
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values his friendships but struggles to fully engage with others.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling isolated and in need of social connection.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw further into himself, perhaps finding solace in quiet contemplation or a solitary activity.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a deep, existential thirst and a profound sense of loneliness.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player

      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Observation

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

William Jones just arrived.
